errors.msg: Claim buffer has already been used
errors.name: ClaimBufferAlreadyUsed

errors.msg: Insufficient encrypted balance for mining fee
errors.name: InsufficientEncryptedBalance

docs: Append encrypted bytes to the claim buffer (Transaction 2+)
Can be called multiple times to fill the buffer with 1088 bytes
instructions.name: append_claim_buffer

docs: Anyone can trigger a claim (doesn't reveal miner identity)
accounts.name: claimer

docs: Privacy protocol configuration (Boxed to reduce stack)
accounts.name: privacy_config

docs: Claim request buffer containing encrypted claim data
accounts.name: claim_request_buffer

docs: The claim being processed (Boxed to reduce stack)
accounts.name: claim

docs: Shared token vault (Boxed to reduce stack)
accounts.name: shared_token_vault

docs: Destination token account (from claim buffer or provided by claimer)
accounts.name: destination_token_account

docs: Arcium sign PDA account (Boxed to reduce stack)
accounts.name: sign_pda_account

docs: Miner claims rewards by providing the secret (encrypted for MPC)
Reads from claim request buffer and queues Arcium MPC computation
- computation_offset: Unique offset for this MPC computation
instructions.name: claim_reward

docs: Depositor who will fund the deposit
accounts.name: depositor

docs: Derived from owner + encrypted_amount for uniqueness
accounts.name: deposit_buffer

docs: Create a deposit buffer with encrypted amount and current state (Step 1)
instructions.name: create_deposit_buffer

docs: Creator can be any wallet (privacy: allows using throwaway wallet)
accounts.name: creator

docs: Derived from creator + encrypted_amount for uniqueness
accounts.name: withdraw_buffer

docs: Create a withdraw buffer with encrypted data (Step 1)
instructions.name: create_withdraw_buffer

docs: Deposit SOL into the shared vault (for fees) - Legacy simple deposit
instructions.name: deposit_fee

docs: Called by Arcium when the balance update MPC completes
instructions.name: deposit_fee_callback

docs: Depositor who created the buffer and funds the deposit
accounts.name: depositor

docs: Execute deposit with MPC balance update (Step 2)
instructions.name: deposit_private

docs: Used for querying miner's encrypted balance
instructions.name: init_check_balance_comp_def

docs: Privacy config (to verify protocol is active)
accounts.name: privacy_config

docs: Claim buffer PDA - unique per owner + secret_hash
accounts.name: claim_buffer

docs: Initialize a claim buffer with metadata (Transaction 1)
Does NOT include the 1088 bytes of encrypted data yet
instructions.name: init_claim_buffer

docs: Claim request buffer PDA (keyed by owner + claim_id)
accounts.name: claim_request_buffer

docs: Initialize a claim request buffer with all data
Now fits in a single transaction since we use [u64; 4] for secret (128 bytes)
instructions.name: init_claim_request_buffer

docs: Used for adding SOL to miner's encrypted balance
instructions.name: init_deposit_fee_comp_def

docs: Used for verifying balance and deducting protocol fee during mining
instructions.name: init_mine_block_comp_def

docs: Used for withdrawing SOL from miner's encrypted balance
instructions.name: init_withdraw_fee_comp_def

docs: Privacy authority PDA (signs CPIs to pow-protocol)
accounts.name: privacy_authority

docs: Shared token vault (holds all mined tokens)
accounts.name: shared_token_vault

docs: Shared fee vault (holds SOL for protocol fees)
accounts.name: shared_fee_vault

docs: Initialize the privacy protocol with shared vaults
instructions.name: initialize

docs: Existing privacy config (must already be initialized)
accounts.name: privacy_config

docs: Privacy authority PDA (token::authority for the vault)
accounts.name: privacy_authority

docs: Shared token vault â€” the PDA token account that holds mined tokens.
Created here if it doesn't exist yet.
accounts.name: shared_token_vault

docs: Shared fee vault (SOL). Just a PDA â€” no init needed, but we derive the bump.
accounts.name: shared_fee_vault

docs: Initialize missing vault PDAs (shared_token_vault) when privacy_config already exists
instructions.name: initialize_vaults

docs: The claim to mark as verified
accounts.name: claim

docs: Called by Arcium when the balance verification and deduction MPC completes
Note: If the miner had insufficient balance, the MPC circuit would have returned
success: false and this callback marks verification as failed
instructions.name: mine_block_callback

docs: Privacy protocol configuration (Boxed to reduce stack)
accounts.name: privacy_config

docs: Claim account to store the encrypted claim (Boxed to reduce stack)
accounts.name: claim

docs: Shared token vault (receives minted rewards) - Boxed to reduce stack
accounts.name: shared_token_vault

docs: PowConfig from normal pool (pool_id=0) - privacy mines the normal pool
accounts.name: pow_config

docs: Other pool PowConfig (seeker pool, pool_id=1) - read-only for supply cap
accounts.name: pow_other_pool

docs: Shared mint authority PDA from pow-protocol
accounts.name: pow_mint_authority

docs: Relayer submits a block with encrypted data directly as parameters
Verifies PoW, queues MPC computation (mine_block) to verify miner balance,
then CPIs to pow-protocol to mint tokens
* `nonce` - The PoW nonce found by miner
* `client_pubkey` - x25519 public key for Arcium decryption
* `secret_hash` - SHA256 hash of the claim secret
instructions.name: submit_block_private

docs: The claim being processed (to get amount and mark as claimed)
accounts.name: claim

docs: Called by Arcium when the verification MPC completes
Note: The MPC verified the secret hash internally. The callback receives
confirmation that verification passed. We use the claim data (stored on-chain)
to determine the transfer amount, and the destination_token_account passed
instructions.name: verify_and_claim_callback

docs: Called by Arcium when the withdrawal verification MPC completes
Note: If the miner had insufficient balance, the MPC circuit would have panicked
and this callback would never be called (transaction reverts automatically)
instructions.name: withdraw_fee_callback

docs: Anyone can trigger the withdrawal (relayer or the miner themself)
accounts.name: caller

docs: Shared fee vault (SOL source for withdrawal)
accounts.name: shared_fee_vault

docs: Destination for the withdrawal (provided in encrypted form, verified by MPC)
accounts.name: destination

metadata.description: Privacy layer for PoW mining using Arcium MPC
metadata.name: pow_privacy

docs: Whether the miner has sufficient balance
fields.name: has_sufficient_balance

docs: The protocol fee that was verified
fields.name: protocol_fee

docs: Claim ID (public, but unlinkable to miner)
fields.name: claim_id

docs: Each block mined creates one claim with encrypted destination
types.name: Claim

docs: Only Arcium MPC can decrypt this
fields.name: encrypted_destination

docs: Client's x25519 public key for Arcium decryption
fields.name: client_pubkey

docs: Miner must provide preimage to claim
fields.name: secret_hash

docs: Whether this claim has been processed
fields.name: is_claimed

docs: Block number when this claim was created
fields.name: block_number

docs: Timestamp when claim was processed (0 if not claimed)
fields.name: claimed_at

docs: Temporary buffer for storing encrypted claim data
Used to split large encrypted payloads across multiple transactions
types.name: ClaimBuffer

docs: Owner who created this buffer (can close it)
fields.name: owner

docs: Encrypted claim ciphertexts (34 x 32 bytes = 1088 bytes)
fields.name: encrypted_claim_bytes

docs: Client's x25519 public key for Arcium decryption
fields.name: client_pubkey

docs: Whether this buffer has been consumed
fields.name: is_used

docs: Temporary buffer for storing encrypted claim request data
Stores: encrypted_claim_id (1 Ã— 32 bytes for Enc<Shared, u64>) + encrypted_secret (4 Ã— 32 = 128 bytes for [u64; 4])
types.name: ClaimRequestBuffer

docs: Claim ID being requested (plaintext for verification)
fields.name: claim_id

docs: Encrypted claim ID ciphertext (1 Ã— 32 bytes for Enc<Shared, u64>)
fields.name: encrypted_claim_id

docs: Encrypted secret ciphertexts (4 Ã— 32 bytes = 128 bytes for [u64; 4])
fields.name: encrypted_secret

docs: Client's x25519 public key for Arcium decryption
fields.name: client_pubkey

docs: Whether this buffer has been consumed
fields.name: is_used

docs: An account storing the current network epoch
types.name: ClockAccount

docs: An account representing a [ComputationDefinition] in a MXE.
types.name: ComputationDefinitionAccount

docs: A computation definition for execution in a MXE.
types.name: ComputationDefinitionMeta

docs: The signature of a computation defined in a [ComputationDefinition].
types.name: ComputationSignature

docs: Buffer for depositing SOL to miner's encrypted balance
Used to store encrypted amount and current state for Arcium MPC
types.name: DepositBuffer

docs: Owner who created this buffer (depositor's public wallet)
fields.name: owner

docs: Amount of lamports being deposited (plaintext for SOL transfer)
fields.name: amount

docs: Encrypted amount for MPC (1 x 32 bytes for Enc<Shared, u64>)
fields.name: encrypted_amount

docs: Encrypted current state (3 x 32 bytes for MinerState: balance, nonce, reserved)
For new miners, this should be encrypted zeros
fields.name: encrypted_current_state

docs: Client's x25519 public key for Arcium decryption
fields.name: client_pubkey

docs: Whether this buffer has been consumed
fields.name: is_used

docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.
types.name: DepositFeeOutput

docs: This is a placeholder - actual implementation will use Arcium SDK
types.name: EncryptedState

docs: Encrypted balance mapping root (Merkle root or similar)
This allows verification without revealing individual balances
fields.name: balance_root

docs: Number of entries in encrypted state
fields.name: entry_count

docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.
types.name: MineBlockOutput

docs: Shared mint authority PDA. Both pools use this to sign mint_to CPI calls.
types.name: MintAuthority

docs: A reference to a node in the cluster.
The offset is to derive the Node Account.
The current_total_rewards is the total rewards the node has received so far in the current
types.name: NodeRef

docs: We currently don't support encrypted outputs yet since encrypted values are passed via
types.name: Output

docs: We differentiate between plaintext and encrypted parameters and data objects.
Plaintext parameters are directly provided as their value.
Encrypted parameters are provided as an offchain reference to the data.
Data objects are provided as a reference to the data object account.
types.name: Parameter

Used to smooth difficulty adjustments and reduce volatility

docs: Number of timestamps stored (0-10, used during initial fill)

Si Pubkey::default() (all zeros), attestation is disabled

docs: Utility struct to store a value that needs to be set by a certain number of participants (keys
in our case). Once all participants have set the value, the value is considered set and we only
types.name: SetUnset

docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.
types.name: VerifyAndClaimOutput

docs: Buffer for withdrawing SOL from miner's encrypted balance
Stores encrypted data for Arcium MPC withdrawal verification
types.name: WithdrawBuffer

docs: Owner who created this buffer (can be throwaway or any wallet)
fields.name: owner

docs: Requested withdrawal amount in lamports (plaintext for verification)
fields.name: amount

docs: Encrypted amount for MPC (1 x 32 bytes for Enc<Shared, u64>)
fields.name: encrypted_amount

docs: Encrypted destination pubkey (4 x 32 = 128 bytes for [u64; 4])
This is where the SOL will be sent
fields.name: encrypted_destination

docs: Encrypted current state (3 x 32 bytes for MinerState: balance, nonce, reserved)
fields.name: encrypted_current_state

docs: Client's x25519 public key for Arcium decryption
fields.name: client_pubkey

docs: Whether this buffer has been consumed
fields.name: is_used

docs: Whether withdrawal was approved by MPC
fields.name: is_approved

docs: Decrypted destination (set after MPC verification, 0s if pending)
fields.name: verified_destination

docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.
types.name: WithdrawFeeOutput
